titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Coll. 390 Item 14: Gaṇeśārthavaśīrṣa

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Coll. 390 Item 14: Gaṇeśārthavaśīrṣa are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Title from colophon (f. 5r); alternate title Gaṇapati arthavaśīrṣa from title pages (f. 1r, 5v).

Mistakes blocked out with black; some marginal additions and corrections; decorative floral borders on front and back covers with characters la, kṣu, ma, ṇ (f. 1r) and rā, ma, caṃ, dra (f. 5v), in corners (clockwise); on bluish paper.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of protective rites, mantras, and praises associated with the name Gaṇapati; manuscript identifies as a Upaniṣad (f. 4v) though likely written in the late medieval period; dedicated to the Hindu deity Gaṇeśa.

msItem.title: Gaṇeśārthavaśīrṣa
गणेशार्थवशीर्ष
msItem.colophon: Colophon: ity upaniṣat // vakratuṃḍāparṇamastu // iti gaṇeśārthavaśīrṣasamāptaḥ // cha śake 1786 saṃvat // 1921 mitīmāghaśukladvitīyātadine pustakam saṁāptam // śrīhanumaṃtāparṇamastu // śrīkāśīviśveśvarāparṇamastu // lakṣumaṇ // cha // (f. 5r).
